website_summaries.verdict: An accurate, easy-to-use, and very inexpensive deep-fry thermometer.
pros: Made of stainless steel with a 12-inch probe
Clip is durable and temperature readings are accurate
cons: The numbers are a little small, so it can be a little hard to read

customer_reviews.title: Not for Homebrew
customer_reviews.text: Awful for home brew, it came up as a recommended item on Amazon when I search for a Homebrew thermostat. It is not precise enough and it's meant for much hotter temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Jared D.

customer_reviews.title: it is very hard to read as it is very little lines and each line represents like 10 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I personally did not care for this thermometer. It was exactly what I was looking for with the long probe, however, it is very hard to read as it is very little lines and each line represents like 10 degrees. Just can't get a super accurate reading if you need one.
customer_reviews.author: Klaudia

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, not dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.text: I already had one of these from another purchase and decided to get a second one for when I do big frying events. This thing works great and I have trusted it for years now to get temp readings on all sorts of oil and grease. I would not recommend putting it into the dishwasher though, as just running it under water while washing it causes condensation to build up inside of it. Goes away as it dries though.
customer_reviews.author: Erik W

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Seemed great and this might be an isolated incident (i.e. the product was a lemon) but the first time we used it the needle (in oil that was just heating up) immediately went to the "fire turn off gas" range and never came back down even after cooling off and trying to shake it / tap it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Gave this with a portable fryer to my son for ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this with a portable fryer to my son for Christmas.Its a must for temperature control and assuring the food is cooked to the appropriate temperature.The only drawback is constant monitoring by having to go outside to read.Others can be programmed to monitor inside.
customer_reviews.author: Jan in LSL

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough for brewing
customer_reviews.text: I do partial mash homebrewing and have broken so many types of glass thermometers I was over it. While saving up for a thermapen I figured I'd try one of these out. It works like a charm, clips on the side of my pot while heating up my strike water and is relatively accurate when checked with a digital thermometer. Good budget option that is much more durable than a floating or lab style thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: URnutzDoc

customer_reviews.title: Helped hit that perfect temp.
customer_reviews.text: Go to use this for the first time while home brewing last weekend. Although the piece itself feels really flemsy and cheaply made, it actually is very sturdy and holds up to high heats.
customer_reviews.author: BigMikeOf33617

customer_reviews.title: It’s not accurate after a few use
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to use this to measure the water temperature for my tea. But after a few times of use, I noticed it wasn’t that accurate (I didn’t drop it or hit it), so I bought 2 more other thermometers to double-check. It turned out those two thermometers showed the same temperature but this one was off. Also, its range is from 10c to 200c, not 0c, it was kinda confused me to read at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Jianteng Li

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a chicken scalding pot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to monitor temperatures in a scalding pot used for chicken plucking. It works well. It is long enough to reach the water. It measures the temperatures accurately enough that we had no torn skin on the birds.
customer_reviews.author: dffswv

customer_reviews.title: The vittles are done!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. Test them in Ice water and boiling water and they are very close. Close enough for me and my vittles
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: It's big
customer_reviews.text: When I received this 12 inch thermometer it was much larger than I expected. I usually do small batch frys, so I'm not sure if it will be accurate, but I decided to keep it to monitor the temperature of more delicate soups like miso and larger batches of curry which can be ruined by high heat ...
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkinzee

customer_reviews.title: Good, but this a fryer thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a good instrument. It is a fryer thermometer, not a brewing thermometer. I should have read the fine print. The graduation in the range from 100 to 200 F is therefore too coarse to be useful for brewing, or composting. Oh well...now I guess I have to go and get me a fryer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice thermometer however it steams up and dial is then hard to read. Comes with a clip to clip onto the turkey pot but I wouldn't recommend leaving the thermometer on there all the time due to steam issues.
customer_reviews.author: Julie S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt measure 750 degrees ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the thermometer quickly, but it is not as advertised. As listed the thermometer should reach 750 degrees. Well... it only measures up to 400 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Temperature is right on. I like that I can compare this to the temp readout on my brewers edge mash and boil to make sure things aren't too hot or too cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Holub

customer_reviews.title: Replacement terk-O-meter for turkey fryer.....
customer_reviews.text: Did you see what I did there..... Turk-O-Meter..... hahaha ....but really thanks .... great thermometer....correct length . AAA+++ DrB
customer_reviews.author: DrB

customer_reviews.title: Not for brewing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work for brewing beer. Temperature range is way too high to be useful. This is a thermometer for frying. C’mon Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Zogduke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for deep frying turkeys
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for deep frying turkeys and knowing the right temperature for maintaining the oil temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective. The clamp worked nicely on the side of my stainless steel pot and is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermometer becuae I was in sure if the pot bundle came with in which it did. I ended up using both thermometers this past thanksgiving one in each sidenodnthe pit when i fried my turkey. Not sure which inenis more accurate this one read 50 degrees hotter then the other on . If I were to do it all over again I would just buy a laser thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Beright32

customer_reviews.title: Basic thermometer- works for us!
customer_reviews.text: We just used it to make fried chicken. It was accurate and was long enough to reach to the bottom of our stock pot. I washed it with a sponge and it seems to be good.
customer_reviews.author: Samie May

customer_reviews.title: Very Long and Unwieldy Meat Thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize this meat thermometer was so long. Very hard to use, and the needle doesn’t go back down to zero when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: After two uses, read out was fogged After he third use it stopped working at all.
customer_reviews.author: Hill Town Trader

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this thermometer to use for Thanksgiving and it didn't register any temperature at all when inserted into the turkey -- the needle didn't even move. Extremely disappointed and now left without a thermometer for my turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Wyant

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: This works for me though I should have played better attention to how long the thing is. But I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: Greggory W. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be accurate, but.......
customer_reviews.text: Seems to accurate, but the provided clip won't stay on my fry pot. I'm going to have rig some other kind of clip, maybe with a clothespin or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It's a thermometer it's well made it tells you the temperature
customer_reviews.author: Jonc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product fast shipping and awesome communication! Product as advertised and holds up to sellers positive feedback!
customer_reviews.author: DDraper

customer_reviews.title: accurate
customer_reviews.text: used for hot water for chicken butchering. we do fifty at a time so important to keep water temp the same for three hours. worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Windy Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Clamp not good enough. Hard to read
customer_reviews.text: Good value and length but clamp does not hold thermometer securely. Probe falls over when clamped to side of pan. Dangerous with hot oil and probe tips over. Dial is also hard to read the fry temps.
customer_reviews.author: GW Finch

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: Came as described. It worked well to check the temp when we deep fried a turkey.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Product is perfect for seafood steaming keep an eye on your temperature
customer_reviews.author: Tricia F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for brewing beer.
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer worked perfectly in my large stock pot. I use it for brewing beer. Highly recommended to all the hole brewers out there
customer_reviews.author: Darrin C.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Broke right out of the box. Not worth sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Debra James

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate and Broken.
customer_reviews.text: A simple tap would cause it to reset to a whole different temperature. Completely inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff King

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: good value. what can one say about a deep fry thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Petrofski

customer_reviews.title: JORGE
customer_reviews.text: please do the correction to the page, the range indicated in for the thermometers is 50f - 750f and when I received are quite different is 50f - 400f.
customer_reviews.author: JORGE

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for your lost turkey fryer thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for frying our Thanksgiving turkey this year! We crank the oil up to 375F before dunking the turkey in oil so the temperature does not drop too much (resulting in an oily bird) and maintain the frying temp at about 300-310F.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo6

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement or addition
customer_reviews.text: Lost the one that came with my fryer. Bought this one and haven't missed the original.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Works great when I'm deep frying fish or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Vstreet

customer_reviews.title: Good little thermometer for the price
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what it said it should do! Used it in my deep fried turkey pot this Thanksgiving No problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: J James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement for your Turkey Fryer!
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice and long for a deep turkey pot. I used it as a thermometer replacement for my Brinkmann fryer.
customer_reviews.author: A Lausch

customer_reviews.title: these things suck.
customer_reviews.text: Just get a laser if you are deep frying, these things suck.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find in stores
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for cooking in a deep pot

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have In The Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Must have in the kitchen. No guess work, better to know for sure.

customer_reviews.title: Needed to use oil frying
customer_reviews.text: Great worked fine got two at once. Broke the one that came with cooker . Came fast and good price with prime shipping

customer_reviews.text: Used it now for a year, very happy, seems accurate. Easy to clean.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great remember not for meat if anyone wants to know and also please take red rubber tip off before use.would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Does not touch the oil in the bottom unless you ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not touch the oil in the bottom unless you have over 1.5 gallons of oil in the container.

customer_reviews.title: Good thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Cooks turkeys all by itself! Well, almost. Nice to monitor the fry oil temp.

customer_reviews.title: Nice temp gauge feature
customer_reviews.text: Love the colored indicators on temp gauge signaling when to turn gas off. Nice length.

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement from my previous unit.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to and works like a charm. Great improvement from my previous unit.

customer_reviews.title: Grab two.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, wish I would have gotten one with a longer / deeper neck to cover the entire pot. Know better next time. Two would be smarter and average them.

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son for his turkey fryer. Works great

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I ordered!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. Came in a larger box than needed. Very accurate for a non-digital (I compared it to a smaller digital thermometer that I have and they were within 2'

customer_reviews.text: Design flaw. Impossible to keep it upright. Keeps falling off the cheap clip. Max temp of 400.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The clamp is not strong enough to hold ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The clamp is not strong enough to hold the thermometer upright in shorter pans, approximately six inches or less
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, temp would not rise above 200F even when plunged into boiling water. Manufacturer apparently expects a high failure rate, as instructions on how to obtain a replacement were printed on the back, and a bored call center promised me another which has yet to arrive. If it never does I shall change this rating to a one-star and include an addendum.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfwerk

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
